data.03: Other Direct Costs (ODC) - Other costs associated with a contract such as freight, travel, postage
data.05: Labor and Material - Sum of labor and material items
data.06: Labor Overhead - Indirect costs associated with direct labor
data.07: Material Overhead - Indirect costs associated with direct material
data.08: Other Overhead - Indirect costs associated with other direct costs
data.09: Total Overhead - Total of all indirect costs incurred on a contract
data.10: Total General and Administrative - Total of all general and administrative types of indirect costs incurred on a contract
data.12: Engineering Overhead - Indirect costs for engineering effort
data.14: Manufacturing Overhead - Indirect costs for manufacturing effort
data.15: Interdivisional Work Authorization - Work to be performed within the same company, but at a different division. - Coding allows tracking of the costs associated with the other division (because indirect costs may be different, etc.)
data.16: Intercomponent Work Authorization - Coding to identify different work groups who may be doing contract work for a specific company or division
data.17: Change Document Number - Contract number to track change documents and related tasks or costs associated with contract changes
data.18: Funds Appropriation - Coding to track the source of funds (such as various government agencies)
data.19: Nonrecurring Labor - Labor costs that will only be incurred once
data.20: Nonrecurring Material - Material costs that will only be incurred once
data.21: Nonrecurring Other Direct Costs - Other direct contract costs that will only be incurred once
data.22: Nonrecurring Subcontract - Subcontract costs that will only be incurred once
data.23: Nonrecurring Labor and Material - Sum of labor and material costs that will only be incurred once
data.24: Nonrecurring Engineering Labor - Engineering labor costs that will only be incurred once
data.25: Nonrecurring Manufacturing Labor - Manufacturing labor that will only be incurred once
data.26: Recurring - Costs that will incur continually over the life of the contract
data.27: Nonrecurring - Costs that will only be incurred once
data.59: Government Furnished Equipment - Government property provided to a contractor that is of a capital nature, including equipment, machine tools, test equipment, etc.; used in manufacturing or providing services in performance of a government contract
data.60: Government Furnished Material - Government property provided to a contractor that is incorporated into or attached to a deliverable end item, or that may be consumed or expended; this includes raw and processed materials, small tools, and supplies that may be consumed in performance of a government contract
data.61: Government Furnished Property - Government property provided to contractors for used in the performance of government contracts such as materials, special tooling, special test equipment, agency-peculiar property, and facilities
data.71: Total Salaries and Wages and Employee Benefits
data.G2: Special Interest Code or Special Program Cost Code
data.I1: Abbreviated Department of Defense (DoD) Budget and Accounting Classification Code (BACC)
data.J2: Abbreviated Installation Budget and Accounting Classification Code (BACC)
data.P5: Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Line Item Number
data.RL: Rental or Lease of Equipment or Facilities
